pdqninja.io
Class MapFile<K>

java.lang.Object
  pdqninja.io.MapFile<K>

public class MapFile<K>
extends Object

A file that stores a sequence of keys (and optionally, the values).

An ExternalMapFile stores a sequence of keys, or a pair or key and values, in a flat file. The objects are stored in their serialized form, which means that these objects must implement the Serializable or the Externalizable interface. The objects are read and written using the ObjectInputStream.readUnshared() and ObjectOutputStream.writeUnshared(Object) methods. While writing to file, the object output stream is reseted after every bytesPerReset bytes.

The file can be opened in a read-only or read-write modes. The mode parameter in the constructor determines the mode of file: "r" opens the file in read-only mode, while "rw" opens the file in read-write mode. In the read-write mode, file will be created if it does not exists. If the file does exists, the file pointer will be located at the first byte.

If the file is opened in read-write mode, this object can also create an index for the file. An entry in the index is a pair of key and the offset within the file where this key is written. One index entry is created every bytesPerIndex bytes.

This object buffers data while reading and writing by using the BufferedInputStream and BufferedOutputStream, respectively. The size of the buffer can be specified in the constructor arguments. When the seek(long) method is called, the existing contents of the read buffer are discarded. Therefore, a calling function can safely seek to an offset and starting reading from there. Although, it is the responsiblity of the calling function to ensure that seeked offset is a valid position from where the ObjectInputStream can correctly read and parse data.

Objects are read from the file with the read() method which returns the next object stored in the file. The objects are written with the write(Object) or the write(Object, Object) methods. The first method writes a key only, and the second methods writes a key and a value.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

MapFile

public MapFile(File file,
               String mode)
        throws IOException
Creates an ExternalMapFile object of the specified file and open it in the specified mode. The valid modes are "r" (read only) and "rw" (read and write). If the specified mode is "rw" (read-write mode), a new file will be created if it did not exist. If the file exists, the file pointer will be located at the first byte. This object will not create an index for the file.

Parameters:
file - the file for reading/writing data
mode - the mode in which to open the file
Throws:
IOException

MapFile

public MapFile(File file,
               String mode,
               long bytesPerReset,
               int bufferSize)
        throws IOException
Creates an ExternalMapFile object of the specified file and open it in the specified mode, using the specified buffer size and resetting the stream after every specified number of bytes (for write mode). The valid modes are "r" (read only) and "rw" (read and write). If the specified mode is "rw" (read-write mode), a new file will be created if it did not exist. If the file exists, the file pointer will be located at the first byte. This object will not create an index for the file.

Parameters:
file - the file for reading/writing data
mode - the mode in which to open the file
bytesPerReset - number of bytes after which the ObjectOutputStream is resetted, or zero to use the default value
bufferSize - the size of the buffers in BufferedInputStream and BufferedOutputStream, or zero to use the default value
Throws:
IOException

MapFile

public MapFile(File file,
               String mode,
               MapFileIndex<K> index,
               long bytesPerIndex,
               long bytesPerReset,
               int bufferSize)
        throws IOException
Creates an ExternalMapFile object of the specified file and open it in the specified mode, using the specified index object to store indices, using the specified buffer size and resetting the stream after every specified number of bytes (for write mode). The valid modes are "r" (read only) and "rw" (read and write). If the specified mode is "rw" (read-write mode), a new file will be created if it did not exist. If the file exists, the file pointer will be located at the first byte. If the index object is not null and bytesPerReset is greater than zero, this object will create index for the file.

Parameters:
file - the file for reading/writing data
mode - the mode in which to open the file
index - the index object
bytesPerIndex - number of bytes after which a new index entry is created
bytesPerReset - number of bytes after which the ObjectOutputStream is resetted, or zero to use the default value
bufferSize - the size of the buffers in BufferedInputStream and BufferedOutputStream, or zero to use the default value
Throws:
IOException
